We are so excited to have English teachers from Minooka Community High School here with us today learning about our Pre-AP program through College Board. They have been able to spend time with our teachers, students, and administrators to ask questions regarding the Pre-AP process and what that looks like in our District.

The College Board created Pre-AP classes as a way to introduce all high school students to the skills and resources they will be using in later high school coursework as well as prepare students for college and career readiness. All Pre-AP courses are open access which means that their high-quality instruction and assessments will serve students of all learning levels.

We are so excited about where Pre-AP has taken our school and are excited to continue to grow in the future. We are also thankful to be able to walk alongside other Districts as they transition into this program for the Fall 2020 semester.

For more in depth information regarding Pre-AP please visit the College Board website at https://pre-ap.collegeboard.org

Earlier this month we hosted a week of lunch and learns centered around equity. Lunch and learn week is a time of professional development for our teachers and staff. During this time, staff use their lunch period to listen and participate in conversations being presented and discussed each day.

Yesterday BBCHS met with teachers from Bradley Central and BUGC to discuss K-12 articulation and student transition into BBCHS. Teachers observed our classrooms and took part in a collaborative conversation to discuss what curriculum at BBCHS looks like. They also focused on how teachers can use their content area to set students up for success during their transition to high school.

Strategy 1.3 of our strategic plan focuses on partnering with elementary districts to improve K-12 articulation. Days like this are huge steps forward for our district. It is always an amazing experience to see teachers across the community collaboratively working together to set students up for success.
